column4: hello ppl, i just assemble a computer from scratch.. i used the ASUS P8Z68-V LX mother board
it has a graphics card on board with DVI/HDMI/VGA out
however the graphics is crappy on Ubuntu 10.10
i think its missing a driver
does anyone know where I could find the driver
sndy bridge wasn't supported at 10.10 i think
no, you can use whatever is in the repos
its very customisable and gtk based, so not much to worry about
how do i ensure that proper drivers for my onboard graphics card are installed
so intel, that means you don't need to install aanything
